name: py-matplotlib

conflicts.name: platform=linux
conflicts.description: MacOSX backend requires the Cocoa headers included with XCode

conflicts.name: platform=cray
conflicts.description: MacOSX backend requires the Cocoa headers included with XCode

conflicts.name: ~image
conflicts.description: Pillow is no longer an optional dependency

variants.name: backend
variants.description: Default backend. All backends are installed and functional as long as dependencies are found at run-time

variants.name: image
variants.description: Enable reading/saving JPEG, BMP and TIFF files

variants.name: fonts
variants.description: Enable support for system font detection

description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: qhull
dependencies.description:
Qhull computes the convex hull, Delaunay triangulation, Voronoi diagram,
halfspace intersection about a point, furt hest-site Delaunay
triangulation, and furthest-site Voronoi diagram. The source code runs
in 2-d, 3-d, 4-d, and higher dimensions. Qhull implements the Quickhull
algorithm for computing the convex hull. It handles roundoff errors from
floating point arithmetic. It computes volumes, surface areas, and
approximations to the convex hull.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-certifi
dependencies.description:
Certifi: A carefully curated collection of Root Certificates for
validating the trustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the
identity of TLS hosts.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-cycler
dependencies.description: Composable style cycles.

dependencies.name: py-kiwisolver
dependencies.description: A fast implementation of the Cassowary constraint solver

dependencies.name: pil
dependencies.description:
Pillow is a fork of the Python Imaging Library (PIL). It adds image
processing capabilities to your Python interpreter. This library
supports many file formats, and provides powerful image processing and
graphics capabilities.

dependencies.name: py-pyparsing
dependencies.description: A Python Parsing Module.

dependencies.name: py-python-dateutil
dependencies.description: Extensions to the standard Python datetime module.

dependencies.name: py-pytz
dependencies.description: World timezone definitions, modern and historical.

dependencies.name: py-subprocess32
dependencies.description: A backport of the subprocess module from Python 3.2/3.3 for 2.x.

dependencies.name: py-functools32
dependencies.description:
Backport of the functools module from Python 3.2.3 for use on 2.7 and
PyPy.

dependencies.name: py-backports-functools-lru-cache
dependencies.description: Backport of functools.lru_cache from Python 3.3

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: tk
dependencies.description:
Tk is a graphical user interface toolkit that takes developing desktop
applications to a higher level than conventional approaches. Tk is the
standard GUI not only for Tcl, but for many other dynamic languages, and
can produce rich, native applications that run unchanged across Windows,
Mac OS X, Linux and more.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt4
dependencies.description:
PyQt is a set of Python v2 and v3 bindings for The Qt Company's Qt
application framework and runs on all platforms supported by Qt
including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android. PyQt4 supports Qt v4
and will build against Qt v5.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt5
dependencies.description:
PyQt is a set of Python v2 and v3 bindings for The Qt Company's Qt
application framework and runs on all platforms supported by Qt
including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android. PyQt5 supports Qt v5.

dependencies.name: py-pygobject
dependencies.description: bindings for the GLib, and GObject, to be used in Python.

dependencies.name: py-wxpython
dependencies.description: Cross platform GUI toolkit for Python.

dependencies.name: py-cairocffi
dependencies.description:
cairocffi is a CFFI-based drop-in replacement for Pycairo, a set of
Python bindings and object-oriented API for cairo. Cairo is a 2D vector
graphics library with support for multiple backends including image
buffers, PNG, PostScript, PDF, and SVG file output.

dependencies.name: py-tornado
dependencies.description: Tornado is a Python web framework and asynchronous networking library.

dependencies.name: ffmpeg
dependencies.description:
FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and
stream audio and video.

dependencies.name: imagemagick
dependencies.description:
ImageMagick is a software suite to create, edit, compose, or convert
bitmap images.

dependencies.name: texlive
dependencies.description:
TeX Live is an easy (we hope) way to get up and running with the TeX
document production system. It provides a comprehensive TeX system with
binaries for most flavors of Unix, including GNU/Linux, macOS, and also
Windows. It includes all the major TeX-related programs, macro packages,
and fonts that are free software, including support for many languages
around the world.

dependencies.name: ghostscript
dependencies.description: An interpreter for the PostScript language and for PDF.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependent_to.name: py-metpy
dependent_to.description:
Collection of tools for reading, visualizing and performing calculations
with weather data.

dependent_to.name: py-basemap
dependent_to.description:
The matplotlib basemap toolkit is a library for plotting 2D data on maps
in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-yahmm
dependent_to.description: YAHMM is a HMM package for Python, implemented in Cython for speed.

dependent_to.name: py-nilearn
dependent_to.description: Statistical learning for neuroimaging in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-labours
dependent_to.description: Python module dependency visualization.

dependent_to.name: callflow
dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a simple and efficient library to minimize
(very) expensive and noisy black-box functions. It implements several
methods for sequential model-based optimization. skopt aims to be
accessible and easy to use in many contexts. The library is built on top
of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: py-mpld3
dependent_to.description:
An interactive D3js-based viewer which brings matplotlib graphics to the
browser.

dependent_to.name: bcftools
dependent_to.description:
BCFtools is a set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the
Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF. All commands
work transparently with both VCFs and BCFs, both uncompressed and BGZF-
compressed.

dependent_to.name: gatetools
dependent_to.description: Python tools for GATE, see https://github.com/OpenGATE/Gate

dependent_to.name: py-hatchet
dependent_to.description:
Hatchet is a performance tool for analyzing hierarchical performance
data using a graph-indexed Pandas dataframe.

dependent_to.name: py-gluoncv
dependent_to.description:
GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,
researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas
and learn computer vision.

dependent_to.name: py-pyani
dependent_to.description:
pyani is a Python3 module that provides support for calculating average
nucleotide identity (ANI) and related measures for whole genome
comparisons, and rendering relevant graphical summary output. Where
available, it takes advantage of multicore systems, and can integrate
with SGE/OGE-type job schedulers for the sequence comparisons.

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: py-abcpy
dependent_to.description:
ABCpy is a highly modular, scientific library for approximate Bayesian
computation (ABC) written in Python. It is designed to run all included
ABC algorithms in parallel, either using multiple cores of a single
computer or using an Apache Spark or MPI enabled cluster.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.

dependent_to.name: py-memprof
dependent_to.description:
memprof logs and plots the memory usage of all the variables during the
execution of the decorated methods.

dependent_to.name: py-cryolobm
dependent_to.description:
The crYOLO boxmanger was written to produce annotation data for crYOLO
as deep learning based particle picking procedure for cryo electro
microscopy.

dependent_to.name: professor
dependent_to.description: Professor Monte-Carlo tuning package

dependent_to.name: py-wub
dependent_to.description:
Bioinformatics tools and a software library developed by the Oxford
Nanopore Technologies Applications group.

dependent_to.name: py-pauvre
dependent_to.description: pauvre: plotting package designed for nanopore and PacBio long reads

dependent_to.name: py-sfepy
dependent_to.description:
SfePy (https://sfepy.org/) is a software for solving systems of coupled
partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in
1D, 2D and 3D. It can be viewed both as black-box PDE solver, and as a
Python package which can be used for building custom applications.

dependent_to.name: py-python-meep
dependent_to.description:
Python-meep is a wrapper around libmeep. It allows the scripting of
Meep-simulations with Python

dependent_to.name: py-salib
dependent_to.description: Python implementations of commonly used sensitivity analysis methods.

dependent_to.name: py-crispresso
dependent_to.description:
Software pipeline for the analysis of CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing
outcomes from deep sequencing data.

dependent_to.name: py-misopy
dependent_to.description:
MISO (Mixture of Isoforms) is a probabilistic framework that quantitates
the expression level of alternatively spliced genes from RNA-Seq data,
and identifies differentially regulated isoforms or exons across
samples.

dependent_to.name: paraview
dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn
dependent_to.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependent_to.name: py-neurokit2
dependent_to.description:
The Python Toolbox for Neurophysiological Signal Processing. This
package is the continuation of NeuroKit 1. It's a user-friendly package
providing easy access to advanced biosignal processing routines.
Researchers and clinicians without extensive knowledge of programming or
biomedical signal processing can analyze physiological data with only
two lines of code.

dependent_to.name: py-arviz
dependent_to.description:
ArviZ (pronounced "AR-vees") is a Python package for exploratory
analysis of Bayesian models. Includes functions for posterior analysis,
model checking, comparison and diagnostics.

dependent_to.name: py-filterpy
dependent_to.description:
This library provides Kalman filtering and various related optimal and
non-optimal filtering software written in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pycbc
dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.

dependent_to.name: py-statsmodels
dependent_to.description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy

dependent_to.name: py-nc-time-axis
dependent_to.description: cftime support for matplotlib axis.

dependent_to.name: py-carputils
dependent_to.description:
The carputils framework for running simulations with the openCARP
software.

dependent_to.name: py-spatialist
dependent_to.description:
This package offers functionalities for user-friendly geo data
processing using GDAL and OGR.

dependent_to.name: cradl
dependent_to.description:
The CRADL proxy application captured performance metrics during
inference on data from multiphysics codes, specifically ALE
hydrodynamics codes.

dependent_to.name: rnaquast
dependent_to.description:
Quality assessment of de novo transcriptome assemblies from RNA-Seq data
rnaQUAST is a tool for evaluating RNA-Seq assemblies using reference
genome and gene database. In addition, rnaQUAST is also capable of
estimating gene database coverage by raw reads and de novo quality
assessment using third-party software.

dependent_to.name: py-vcf-kit
dependent_to.description:
VCF-kit is a command-line based collection of utilities for performing
analysis on Variant Call Format (VCF) files.

dependent_to.name: py-pydmd
dependent_to.description:
PyDMD is a Python package that uses Dynamic Mode Decomposition for a
data-driven model simplification based on spatiotemporal coherent
structures.

dependent_to.name: parsec
dependent_to.description:
PaRSEC: the Parallel Runtime Scheduler and Execution Controller PaRSEC
is a runtime and a programming toolbox that support the design and
parallel execution of micro-tasks on distributed, heterogeneous systems.

dependent_to.name: py-checkm-genome
dependent_to.description:
Assess the quality of microbial genomes recovered from isolates, single
cells, and metagenomes

dependent_to.name: py-chainer
dependent_to.description:
Chainer is a Python-based deep learning framework aiming at
flexibility. It provides automatic differentiation APIs based on the
define-by-run approach (a.k.a. dynamic computational graphs) as well as
object-oriented high-level APIs to build and train neural networks. It
also supports CUDA/cuDNN using CuPy for high performance training and
inference.

dependent_to.name: prmon
dependent_to.description: Standalone monitor for process resource consumption.

dependent_to.name: py-openmc
dependent_to.description:
The OpenMC project aims to provide a fully-featured Monte Carlo particle
transport code based on modern methods. It is a constructive solid
geometry, continuous-energy transport code that uses ACE format cross
sections. The project started under the Computational Reactor Physics
Group at MIT.

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)

dependent_to.name: py-arcgis
dependent_to.description: ArcGIS API for Python.

dependent_to.name: yoda
dependent_to.description: YODA - Yet more Objects for Data Analysis

dependent_to.name: py-cmocean
dependent_to.description: Colormaps for Oceanography.

dependent_to.name: py-ucsf-pyem
dependent_to.description:
UCSF pyem is a collection of Python modules and command-line utilities
for electron microscopy of biological samples.

dependent_to.name: py-py6s
dependent_to.description:
A wrapper for the 6S Radiative Transfer Model to make it easy to run
simulations with a variety of input parameters, and to produce outputs
in an easily processable form.

dependent_to.name: py-sncosmo
dependent_to.description: SNCosmo is a Python library for high-level supernova cosmology analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-multiqc
dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.

dependent_to.name: py-geoplot
dependent_to.description:
geoplot is a high-level Python geospatial plotting library. It's an
extension to cartopy and matplotlib which makes mapping easy: like
seaborn for geospatial.

dependent_to.name: py-pygps
dependent_to.description:
pyGPs is a Python library for Gaussian Process (GP) Regression and
Classification.

dependent_to.name: draco
dependent_to.description:
Draco is an object-oriented component library geared towards numerically
intensive, radiation (particle) transport applications built for
parallel computing hardware. It consists of semi-independent packages
and a robust build system.

dependent_to.name: py-illumina-utils
dependent_to.description:
A library and collection of scripts to work with Illumina paired-end
data (for CASAVA 1.8+).

dependent_to.name: pism
dependent_to.description: Parallel Ice Sheet Model

dependent_to.name: py-brian
dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks

dependent_to.name: py-xgboost
dependent_to.description:
XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed
to be highly efficient, flexible and portable.

dependent_to.name: py-python-picard
dependent_to.description: Preconditoned ICA for Real Data.

dependent_to.name: py-cogent
dependent_to.description: A toolkit for statistical analysis of biological sequences.

dependent_to.name: py-pycocotools
dependent_to.description: Official APIs for the MS-COCO dataset.

dependent_to.name: py-lifelines
dependent_to.description:
Survival analysis was originally developed and applied heavily by the
actuarial and medical community. Its purpose was to answer *why do
events occur now versus later* under uncertainty (where *events* might
refer to deaths, disease remission, etc.). *lifelines* is a pure Python
implementation of the best parts of survival analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-ase
dependent_to.description:
The Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) is a set of tools and Python
modules for setting up, manipulating, running, visualizing and analyzing
atomistic simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-gallery
dependent_to.description:
A `Sphinx` extension that builds an HTML version of any Python script
and puts it into an examples gallery.

dependent_to.name: lbann
dependent_to.description:
LBANN: Livermore Big Artificial Neural Network Toolkit. A distributed
memory, HPC-optimized, model and data parallel training toolkit for deep
neural networks.

dependent_to.name: py-cnvkit
dependent_to.description: Copy number variation toolkit for high-throughput sequencing.

dependent_to.name: py-damask
dependent_to.description: Pre- and post-processing tools for DAMASK

dependent_to.name: minigan
dependent_to.description:
miniGAN is a generative adversarial network code developed as part of
the Exascale Computing Project's (ECP) ExaLearn project at Sandia
National Laboratories.

dependent_to.name: py-mlxtend
dependent_to.description:
Mlxtend (machine learning extensions) is a Python library of useful
tools for the day-to-day data science tasks.

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: py-opppy
dependent_to.description:
The Output Parse-Plot Python (OPPPY) library is a python based data
analysis library designed to extract, store, and plot information from
output and dump files generated by scientific software packages.

dependent_to.name: py-seaborn
dependent_to.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependent_to.name: py-phonopy
dependent_to.description:
Phonopy is an open source package for phonon calculations at harmonic
and quasi-harmonic levels.

dependent_to.name: py-colorpy
dependent_to.description:
ColorPy is a Python package to convert physical descriptions of light -
spectra of light intensity vs. wavelength - into RGB colors that can be
drawn on a computer screen. It provides a nice set of attractive plots
that you can make of such spectra, and some other color related
functions as well.

dependent_to.name: timemory
dependent_to.description:
Modular profiling toolkit and suite of libraries and tools for
C/C++/Fortran/CUDA/Python

dependent_to.name: geopm
dependent_to.description:
GEOPM is an extensible power management framework targeting HPC. The
GEOPM package provides libgeopm, libgeopmpolicy and applications
geopmctl and geopmpolicy, as well as tools for postprocessing. GEOPM is
designed to be extended for new control algorithms and new hardware
power management features via its plugin infrastructure. Note: GEOPM
interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs). For
propper usage make sure MSRs are made available directly or via the msr-
safe kernel module by your administrator.

dependent_to.name: py-quast
dependent_to.description: Quality Assessment Tool for Genome Assemblies

dependent_to.name: py-gpyopt
dependent_to.description:
Performs global optimization with different acquisition functions.
Among other functionalities, it is possible to use GPyOpt to optimize
physical experiments (sequentially or in batches) and tune the
parameters of Machine Learning algorithms. It is able to handle large
data sets via sparse Gaussian process models.

dependent_to.name: py-htseq
dependent_to.description:
HTSeq is a Python package that provides infrastructure to process data
from high-throughput sequencing assays.

dependent_to.name: py-contextily
dependent_to.description: Context geo-tiles in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-wxmplot
dependent_to.description: wxPython plotting widgets using matplotlib.

dependent_to.name: py-pyugrid
dependent_to.description: Work with triangular unstructured grids and the data on them.

dependent_to.name: py-dask-glm
dependent_to.description:
Dask-glm is a library for fitting Generalized Linear Models on large
datasets.

dependent_to.name: py-pydv
dependent_to.description:
PDV is a 1D graphics and data analysis tool, heavily based on the ULTRA
plotting tool

dependent_to.name: py-wradlib
dependent_to.description:
wradlib is designed to assist you in the most important steps of
processing weather radar data. These may include: reading common data
formats, georeferencing, converting reflectivity to rainfall intensity,
identifying and correcting typical error sources (such as clutter or
attenuation) and visualising the data.

dependent_to.name: reprimand
dependent_to.description:
RePrimAnd is a support library for numerical simulations of general
relativistic magnetohydrodynamics. If provides methods for recovering
primitive variables like pressure and velocity from the variables
evolved in quasi-conservative formulations. Further, it provides a
general framework for handling matter equations of state.

dependent_to.name: py-umi-tools
dependent_to.description: Tools for handling Unique Molecular Identifiers in NGS data sets

dependent_to.name: qmcpack
dependent_to.description:
QMCPACK, is a modern high-performance open-source Quantum Monte Carlo
(QMC) simulation code.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, transforms, and models for geospatial data. TorchGeo
is a PyTorch domain library, similar to torchvision, that provides
datasets, transforms, samplers, and pre-trained models specific to
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: py-deeptools
dependent_to.description:
deepTools addresses the challenge of handling the large amounts of data
that are now routinely generated from DNA sequencing centers.

dependent_to.name: py-pymatgen
dependent_to.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.

dependent_to.name: candle-benchmarks
dependent_to.description: ECP-CANDLE Benchmarks

dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics

dependent_to.name: py-dadi
dependent_to.description:
Fit population genetic models of demography and selection using
diffusion approximations to the allele frequency spectrum

dependent_to.name: py-wcsaxes
dependent_to.description:
WCSAxes is a framework for making plots of Astronomical data in
Matplotlib.

dependent_to.name: py-imgaug
dependent_to.description:
A library for image augmentation in machine learning experiments,
particularly convolutional neural networks. Supports the augmentation of
images, keypoints/landmarks, bounding boxes, heatmaps and segmentation
maps in a variety of different ways.

dependent_to.name: py-dp-gp-cluster
dependent_to.description:
DP_GP_cluster clusters genes by expression over a time course using a
Dirichlet process Gaussian process model.

dependent_to.name: py-localcider
dependent_to.description: Tools for calculating sequence properties of disordered proteins

dependent_to.name: bart
dependent_to.description: BART: Toolbox for Computational Magnetic Resonance Imaging

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: uqtk
dependent_to.description:
Sandia Uncertainty Quantification Toolkit. The UQ Toolkit (UQTk) is a
collection of libraries and tools for the quantification of uncertainty
in numerical model predictions

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-healpy
dependent_to.description: healpy is a Python package to handle pixelated data on the sphere.

dependent_to.name: py-espressopp
dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo++ is an extensible, flexible, fast and parallel simulation
software for soft matter research. It is a highly versatile software
package for the scientific simulation and analysis of coarse-grained
atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft matter research

dependent_to.name: alps
dependent_to.description:
Algorithms for Physics Simulations Tags: Condensed Matter Physics,
Computational Physics

dependent_to.name: cosmomc
dependent_to.description:
CosmoMC is a Fortran 2008 Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo (MCMC) engine for
exploring cosmological parameter space, together with Fortran and python
code for analysing Monte-Carlo samples and importance sampling (plus a
suite of scripts for building grids of runs, plotting and presenting
results).

dependent_to.name: py-rsatoolbox
dependent_to.description: Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA) in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-descartes
dependent_to.description:
Use Shapely or GeoJSON-like geometric objects as matplotlib paths and
patches
